definition:
The concept of a squarefull number can be generalized. Let
$n \in \mathbb{Z}$ with $n>1$. Then $m \in \mathbb{Z}$ is [*$n$-full*]{}
if, for every prime $p$ dividing $m$, $p^n$ divides $m$.

Note that $m$ is $n$-full if and only if there exist
$a_0, \dots, a_{n-1} \in \mathbb{Z}$ such that
$\displaystyle m=\prod_{j=0}^{n-1} {a_j}^{n+j}$.
